page.title: 20BIRDS IN ABERDYFI
page.content: The plentiful supply of food living in the sand and mudflats attract wading birds and waterfowl.The most numerous waders are dunlin,ringed plover,oystercatcher and curlew.Also seen are bar-tailed godwit,grey plover greenshank and redshank.Throughout the year cormorants can be seen fishing and standing on the sand banks.In summer herring gulls,black-backed gulls, crows and jackdaws make a thorough job of cleaning up anything edible left by the large number of visitors to the area. { This record was researched and {written by final year pupils of {Bramford Primary School,Dudley during {a one week stay in Aberdyfi,June 1985 {They would like to place on record {their thanks to the people of Aberdyfi {for making their stay so rewarding.
